page.title: 10THE CANAL
page.content: Running across the survey area is the Staffordshire and Worcestershire Canal; which runs from Stourport to nearby Wolverhampton. The Canal was engineeered by James Brindley soon after the completion of the Trent and Mersey Canal. Opened in 1772 the Canal is no longer an important source of transport. It is today a source of leisure-Boating Holidays and Fishing. The section of Canal runs from Pool Hall Fartm rising to Wightwick Mill LOck(this is apparently one of the oldest sections of the Canal). A total of two locks and four bridges. At Wightwick Bridge there is still a Boatyard and Hire Centre. Down at Pool Hall Farm there is a large resevoir which is well used by the local Angling Club.
